reasoning: Overweight and obesity measured as prevalence (proportion of population affected), not incidence. Global prevalence approximately 32.5% (32,500 per 100k) in 2005 based on WHO estimates, varying significantly by region from ~15% in Asia to >60% in North America.
source: Kelly T et al. (2008). Global burden of obesity in 2005 and projections to 2030. Int J Obes. 32:1431-1437
